ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] Hello everyone
ygData.msgSnippet: Woah thank Pixy!  You know, Brell isn t the same without you guys.  Anyway. this is great information.  I m debating when I start duel weilding whether to duel
ygData.messageBody:
Woah thank Pixy! You know, Brell isn't the same without you guys. Anyway.
this is great information. I'm debating when I start duel weilding whether
to duel weild my Ebony Blade and Gnoll Hide lariat, both magic with procs or
whether to use the mino axe with better damage/delay ratio than the lariat
but not magic and no proc. (Of course, neither proc YET, but I keep
hoping - haven't tried the lariat in awhile). Just hit 15 and looking
forward to camoflauge so I can go to sister isle (they have a new roaming
mob around 30 that isn't very nice) and get the rest of the stuff I need for
my Longshot Bow.

Druids didn't have any cool quest type stuff to get and so I'm really
looking forward to doing the quests for armor and equipment and spells (that
one is hard as I recall Sylv rallying forces to do it not all that long
ago).

Anyway, great to hear from you!

Ice
----- Original Message -----
From: Christina Norman <tina@...>
To: <EQ_women@egroups.com>
Sent: Friday, October 20, 2000 5:41 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ_women] Hello everyone



The Ebony Blade is found in lower guk live side. It's a pretty cool
ranger only sword, that procs a root that does some damage. It's
considered a good low level ranger weapon.

Around 30-40 level many prefer switching to an Electrum Bladed Wakizatci
(or two). This sword has a better damage ratio, and is very light and
fast. This is the one you need the fangs for.

Around level 40-50 most rangers try and pick up Yakeshas and a flowing
black silk sash. Yakesha is a very popular weapon, with the same ratio as
the EBW and a nice 75 point damage proc. EBWs are IMHO almost as good
however, and you're fine with a pair of those at 50.

A good two handed sword will have better damage output than dual wielding
up to around level 35 or so. It depends on your weapons though. Some
good two handed ranger weapons are:
- Axe of the iron black (Found commonly in Kunark, sold for a couple
hundred plat I believe. This puppy really owns, it is good to 40th level
for sure. Pick one up.)
- Shiny Brass Halberds (SBH) and Blackened Iron Bastard Swords (BIBS)
are good up to level 30 or so.
- I'm not really up to date on all the crazy Kunark weapons, I know
there are a lot of powerful ones around now

Pixy, level 52 Ranger (Retired), Brell Serilis

On Thu, 19 Oct 2000, Suzanne J. Johnson wrote:

> Hiya, Judy. =) Well, it's hard to kick the habit but essentially
schoolwork pretty much demanded it. I took two accelerated courses this
summer and that really kicked my butt, which made it aLOT easier to say
goodbye. Also, Verant had upset me personally over my account (which I'd
had since March of '99, without EVER missing a payment, thank you very
much), and there was the whole fact that Celedhros and I were finding that
our battle plans were starting to take on the complexity of a good Othello
match. <grin> Two rangers can be VERY effective, if the rangers in question
are very, very careful... anyway, it was all getting to be a bit much, and
school comes first.
>
> Ebony blade... wow... that's the one we collected the fangs for, right?
>
